Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: chickadee830
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at a Days Inn and it was an unpleasant experience. The room smelled damp and musty, with an aura of old tobacco smoke. This is a smoke-free hotel. The tiles just inside the door and in the bathroom were grimy. The furniture was of cheap quality and chipped. The smoke detector was yellowed and appeared separated from its housing on the ceiling. The worst part of our stay occurred from 3:30 until 4:30 am. We were awakened by shouts, loud knocking and banging doors. Other guests had returned to their rooms and seemed oblivious to the time or the fact that the hotel had a 'quiet policy' after 9:00 pm. We will not stay here again, nor will we recommend it to anyone. This is most unfortunate, since it is the only hotel in an area of Toronto which boasts unique stores and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A reliable Wifi would give this hotel a better score”
Reviews.Author: GrannyDee2011
Reviews.Content: Speaking as a native of Toronto and the Beaches district, I can say that this is a very good value if you want to integrate a trendy Beaches experience with easy access to the core of the city. You can hear and feel the streetcars going by, but it is still fairly quiet in spite of this. It was pretty clean. The furniture was dated but the room well equipped with everything except a microwave. The complimentary breakfast is "meh". Service was fine. The wifi was very disappointing and we needed it on that trip.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time....great location....extremely clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slender1
Reviews.Content: Initial impression: reminded me of a rooming house with the 9:00 p.m. quiet rule; no guests after 9:00 p.m.; small rooms BUT it was extremely clean, smoke-free, comfortable. The rooms are small and do-able if one is looking for a one or two night stay. Would request a king bed next time. The shortest member of our party was 5'11" so had to sleep diagonal on the bed. Quite enjoyed the breakfast the next morning - variety of fruit, breads, cereals, coffee, tea, apple and orange juice. The evening clerk at the front desk was efficient but not personable. The morning/day clerk was friendly and helpful and made up for the evening clerk. Overall, sure stay here. It's clean, pretty quiet, smoke-free, parking included. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience - not worth it the 'discounted' rate”
Reviews.Author: drew4u99
Reviews.Content: Travelers be warned: this hotel suffers from poor customer service and sketchy billing practices. It's been two weeks since my visit, and I've the terrible experience still lingers...resurfacing with a random, fraudulent charge on my credit card weeks later. It all started on a busy weekend evening. The lobby was full of guests, and customer service rep. 'Anthony' began to become loud, and aggressive in his handling of the volume. He began making threats to guests taking too long, spewing warnings of violence, should the customer not hurry up with their documentation. Some other customers threatened to notify corporate, or the police, should he continue. No reaction. Didn't care. At this point, I quickly checked in, avoiding eye contact with the staff member...only to have him blast me with some racist comment as I walked away. Having enough, I told him I would be sending a complaint to Days Inn corporate on his behavior. I did. They did nothing. Two weeks later, I check my credit card statement, and a charge occurring 3 days AFTER my visit had been placed on my card. Is this the cost of atrocious customer service? All I can do now is dispute the charge and forewarn other customers.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: wdaliangiup
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 4 days. Friendly staff. Anthony is the best! The price is excellent for the winter when there were not many visitors for beaches. Location is good too. 501 light rail takes about 20-30 minutes to downtown. Room is clean and well maintained. Quiet and comfortable. Free Internet and pretty good breakfast. The only problem I encountered was that there was a couple who were apparently had issues at one night. They were screaming at 3 in the morning. They were kicked out finally.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: EDP10001
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights with my wife at this location last week during an official visit to Toronto. Contrary to what some other visitorsâ€™ comments on tripadvisor, our experience were much better than expected. The location was just fantastic, we parked our car at the hotel and used public transport to get around, and that was very convenient. Room was clean and comfortable. The product we got for the price paid was very good. At check-in, we met Anthony and Checked-out with Gregory, both treated us very well. We will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Matthew L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many days inns on my travels to USA previously and still like their value for money offering. For a party of 2 male adults the 2 double bed rooms are a great plus along with free wifi and cable TV stations for under $100 a night is all I want. Location is out of town but the streetcar (501) stops outside and takes you to all major intersections within downtown in approx. 20 mins and I preferred the out of town more "real" location with the ability to travel into town easily as and when we wanted. Nice local bars, shops and boutiques all close by for exploring and walkable to the beachfront and views of Lake Ontario. Staff very helpful assisting us with a spare battery charges which we had forgot and plenty of local advice and transport options to the places we wanted to go. Free breakfast was also a plus

Reviews.Title: “A Disappointment: 09/21/2011 - 09/25/2011”
Reviews.Author: customerMission
Reviews.Content: My husband and I paid $665.84 (without taxes) for a four night stay for a room with a kitchenette. (I was told it was the only room available, and we needed a room in that area.) The kitchenette was clearly unsanitary: dust, grime and food crumbs covered surfaces on the shelves--food particles were stuck to some plates and glasses. You felt sticky grease on the stovetop, countertops and all cupboard handles. I took a picture of the large bag of what appeared to be food/spices that was left in one of the kitchen cupboards. Disheartened, I filled the sink with soapy water to try to clean dishes and surfaces--but realized I didn't pay for a hotel room so that I could come in and clean a disgusting mess I did not make. We paid for cleanliness, and Days Inn did not deliver. The draining board was literally covered in grime and what looked like food bits. Furthermore, no dishcloth was provided. When I requested a dishcloth, I received a facecloth from the bathroom. When I showed the housekeeper the draining board she laughed. I then proceeded to show the man at the front desk. He said he was the manager, and he didn't seem to care. He stood there making excuses. Fortunately, a maintenance person, Vern, happened to pass by, took one look at the draining board and said, "That is disgusting." Later, Vern knocked on our room door, handed us the draining board he had personally cleaned himself, and asked if he could inspect the kitchen. When he had a good look at it, he agreed that the kitchen was badly neglected and unsanitary. He said it was inexcusable and unacceptable. I tried writing a complaint on an online form Days Inn says it provides for its customers; but, when I tried to submit it it kept stating that the site was "being serviced", so could not submit the form. No where is there an address to reach anyone in real authority. I feel Days Inn is giving us false promises of cleanliness and, from our experience, lacks respect for its customers. We were charged for a kitchen we could not use due to its unsanitary condition. That's robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Two and a half stars-Too much for not enough”
Reviews.Author: Ted1945
Reviews.Content: I would allow the Days Inn Beaches some latitude if they hadn't been so expensive. I was part of a wedding party that booked a block of rooms and the deal they gave is was $129 a night. And the regular price was $129 a night. Not much saving for volume trade there. Its an old hotel and the air quality was not good. The through the wall air units were inefficient at best and the windows were screwed shut so you could not open them for fresh air. The continental breakfast room is tiny, only three tables, and the variety of offerings is minimal, cereals and croissants and bread and some tiny, and I mean tiny, muffins. Regardless, the rooms were clean and everything worked. The beds were excellent and the units were quiet. The staff were kind and cooperative, as they should be, and all reservations were correct. Parking was free which helped the cost factor.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty plain, but ok”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl R
Reviews.Content: If you stay here, request a room that isn't on the bottom floor, as the windows do not open and it is quite stuffy and smelly. We stayed here two separate times on the same vacation - first time on the second floor which was good. It's clean but the a/c was very loud. The internet is slow and they charge you $1.00 for local calls. The second time we stayed was not a good experience as we were on the first floor and the windows are screwed shut. If you need a cab, call or hail it yourself - don't get the front desk to order it. When we left for the airport, the front desk guy called us a cab, then he waited outside for it to come and charged the driver $10.00 for getting him the business! I'm sure that upped our price as I heard the flat rate was $60.00 and our cab ride cost us $70.00. It is easy to get down town from here and the beautiful sandy beach is walking distance. I wish there were more restaurants near, but there were a few. It shouldn't cost so much for what you get, but it was one of the cheeper places to stay in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very easy access to the city, but smaller rooms”
Reviews.Author: NYPhysician
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2010. This facility is located on the eastern side Queen Street which is one of the big streets that traverses across the city. It would take about 10 minutes to get there by cab (costs about $15 from city center) and about 20-30 minutes by public transit (Tram that costs about $2 from downtown). The bus stop is located about 50 meters from the hotel and it is an easy hop-on and hop-off from there to the city's center. Tram service is round the clock, although frequency is much less after 8 pm. But, safety is definitely not an issue as this seemed to be a very good neighborhood. Plenty of restaurants and fast food chains within walkable distance from here. As far as the facility itself is concerned, it is alright, but not the best of the Days Inn facilities I've stayed in. The room was quite small, but clean. If you get a room facing the street, you may hear the noise of street cars through the night, but it is not terrible. Staff were alright, overall helpful, but some of them seemed curt and dry. Breakfast was OK. Room service was good. Overall, this is probably the cheapest decent hotel you would find in such proximity to the city's center for the quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “modest price, clean, 5 min walk to lake, will be back”
Reviews.Author: 30dayworld
Reviews.Content: easy access to everywhere . room a touch on the small side .But only there to sleep, friendly staff and breakfast. Back at hotel at 8, changed, walk to beach swim till 9 dinner on way back to hotel. It all worked for the 3 of us.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is....”
Reviews.Author: JSCrowe
Reviews.Content: If you're just looking to crash somewhere for a night, this is a decent place with decent location but that's really it. It's nothing to write home about. It's just simply a simple hotel. The rooms are ok but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: dcp_xo
Reviews.Content: The hotel smelled awful and right from the start the front desk staff was rude. He spent 10 minutes ignoring us while we tried to check in. Our room was on the second floor and it smelled like something DIED up there. Our room itself smelled like stale cigarettes, which was gross considering it was a smoke-free hotel. The room wasn't very clean, it was dusty and I found cobwebs. The curtains were broken and wouldn't fully close (our room overlooked the main street). When one of us tried the blow-dryer it sparked. It was very noisy, people on our floor were slamming doors constantly and running around the hall. People were banging on the wall, and the front desk staff accused us of being noisy when we complained. We were called down because they had a problem processing the credit card and the front desk staff was EXTREMELY RUDE. He blamed us and said to go to the bank or we would have to leave. Nothing was open since it was New Years eve, which should have been obvious to him but he proceeded repeat the policy. The "free wireless internet" is a joke because it requires you to create an account on some website and give all of your personal information to them (so they can sell it to everyone and anyone who will then spam you to death). Even after all of this, we were still determined to have a good time and went out for a few hours to celebrate New Years eve down at Liberty Grand. However, when we returned and expected to go up to our room with two visitors, the manager and the front desk staff had locked the front doors and stood there with a clipboard to check that only people who had registered entered the hotel. This might seem like a good idea if we were at summer camp... or a retirement home... or even somewhere exclusive. But I've never before paid $170 for a hotel room and not been allowed to have a guest to my room. We offered the staff $50 to make an exception but they refused and just kept repeating their "policy" over and over again like robots. When we questioned their policy, rather than answer us they just said that its their policy (in other words, they were RUDE, UNPROFESSIONAL and UNCOOPERATIVE). They suggested we pay for another room at $160 and send the two visitors there, which is ridiculous. We asked to be reimbursed because after being offended and disrespected we wanted to take a cab home, but they refused that as well because "it is policy." They deactivated our room keys so that we couldn't get back in and then the robotic manager "Geoff" said he'd let two of us go get all of our stuff from the room but he disappeared for 20 minutes before he did. In the end, we left without getting a refund. We took a cab all the way back to Thornhill (45 minutes away) at 4am and had to go get our car from the parking lot the next day (today). I have never been more disgusted and upset by a hotel. I want everyone to be warned about this place, it was absolutely AWFUL. Their "POLICY" is to offend their paying customers. I wouldn't recommend Days Inn Beaches to my enemy. I want my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place!”
Reviews.Author: bellep
Reviews.Content: We travel to Toronto multiple times a year. To our delight while we were exploring one of the many great neighborhoods Toronto has to offer, the Beach, we saw this hotel and since our next visit we have been staying there ever since. It's in a great location, only a quick streetcar ride into downtown, and the Beach itself is a delight! A short walk to the beach and tons of little shops and restaurants in the neighborhood. The hotel itself is a great value. Free parking and free wi-fi are a deal and there is a free breakfast which is a plus. The desk clerks are friendly, Anthony is my favorite, and they are always attentive. The rooms are nothing fancy, but they are clean and we have never had an issue in the ten plus times we have stayed there over the past two years. We will be back in Toronto in December and of course staying at there once again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: copper71
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Toronto for the first time in five years & was accompanied by my youngest son. I chose this hotel because of its fairly close proximity to the downtown and also because of its closeness to friends I wanted to visit. Had I not been visiting other areas of Ontario, I could have easily spent my entire week at this hotel. Gregory, Front Desk Manager, set us at ease immediately upon our arrival on Nov. 15th & was also working when we left on Nov 16th. He was extremely polite & helpful with directions and information on local public transit. Our room was top notch in every way. I will probably be back to Toronto in 2012 & hope to make this my home away from home at that time.

Reviews.Title: “Neither great nor bad”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDaddy
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel would have gotten a much better rating if the price would be lower. For something that I pay $119 a night or more I actually do expect more than an average motel quality. The hotel seems to be very short staffed, usually there is one guy at the front desk who answers your questions, takes care of all the check ins and check outs, refreshes the breakfast (which is nice to be included in the price but nothing to rave about) etc. The two different people I dealt with during my stay were very helpful and extremely friendly. But unfortunately this couldn't mask the fact the hotel needs a major renovation. As people mentioned before, it kind of smells stuffy, the hallway is very narrow. Everything is old and dated. Upon closer inspection it is clean, but the first impression is it is not because of the wear and tear. Our bedsheets and the cover sheet had several old stains on. Even though I could tell they were freshly laundered (the sheets for sure, the cover I am not so sure), a serious hotel would have just discarded those and brought in new ones. Our room was not facing the car wash so I don't know how that affects the rooms or not. But I can tell for sure the off track horse betting place across the street which was mentioned here before is in no way threatening or making people feel uncomfortable. If a few old men standing on the street smoking a cigarette across the street disturb you, then it might. A little bit west of the hotel it might get a bit edgy for some people, but the hotel is at the west end of one of the most desirable neighborhoods Torontos, so just keep walking east or south (that is where the beach is) and you will be very happy with the location. If they would change their pricing to something below $100, I would definitely come back. As it is, I think it is overpriced for what it offers. The only reason they can take so much money is the fact if you need a hotel and want to be in the area, this one is your only option, unless you are into the cozier, but even more expensive local B&Bs. The next hotels are either Downtown or the next DaysInn 8km up on Kingston Road.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelgalMission_BC
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel! After reading some of the other reviews I'd considered cancelling. Yet our room was clean, beds were good, linens clean and bathroom basic but just fine also. Standard conveniences in the room: TV, iron,small fridge,clock, a/c, etc. The location was handy to our family, parking was easy, and staff were pleasant. Breakfast looked good but we only took a piece of fruit and went out to a local cafe for coffee [Voulez-vous cafe, a few blocks to the west]. The only drawback to the hotel is the lack of an elevator between floors for getting luggage up and down. I didn't see other rooms but the hallways had good carpet and were clean & pleasant. This hotel is a good option if you need to be in the area, not luxury but definitely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay !”
Reviews.Author: bee2010Ottawa
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were Great! Nice little hotel,See photos

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: louisaisabel
Reviews.Content: I am staying here right now and I would never recommend this hotel. I'm awake at 5:30 AM because the neon lights from the car wash next door, which is level with my room, are keeping me awake. The curtains don't close properly and are letting the neon light in from the car wash. There was no one to check us in when we arrived. It took some time before someone came back to the front desk. Also, thankfully, I was wasn't alone when I checked in because the hotel is located across from an off-track betting business and seems less than safe. Some guy was cursing in the lobby when we arrived. When I called the front desk to ask about how to use the Internet they told me to come to the lobby. The receptionist was impatient and unpleasant. To top it all off, the room has a stale, cigarette smell probably caused by poor ventilation. It's just depressing!

Reviews.Title: “Very fine, convenient and pleasant little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrewjn
Reviews.Content: I read some of the critical reviews above after I booked but have to say this place is a pleasant surprise in all respects -- and I moved here after 9 days in the 5-star Sutton Place in downtown Toronto. Clean quiet room, with just the slightest swish of streetcars a block away to remind you of where you are. Clean modern bathroom and shower with instant hot water, excellent pressure. FREE WiFi internet ($18 a day at Sutton Place). Free continental breakfast. Free parking ($10 a day at Sutton Place). Pleasant staff. Close to everything. NO SMOKING in any of the rooms and everything (sheets, towels) smells clean and fresh. Only drawback is no elevator to 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except for the one big problem”
Reviews.Author: x94cherry
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to like about this hotel. It's certainly not glamorous, but I really like the location, close enough to everything but a little more residential and relaxed than the places right downtown. The rooms (unless you get the cheapest Queen bed rooms) are pleasant and above average for a Days Inn. And free parking is always a plus in a big city. But here's the thing--the heating and air conditioning system is not adequate. They rooms have the dreaded swamp coolers in the windows and--here's the one big problem--they do not have thermostats. They have three settings: blasting hot air all the time, blasting cold air all the time, and off. So you have to fool with it constantly to maintain a consistent temperature. When I first got to my room, I assumed my heater was broken and explained the situation to the desk clerk. He said that's the way it is, they're all like that. He acted like I was crazy when I told him that every other hotel room I've ever stayed in can maintain a constant temperature on its own. He acted like he had never heard of such a thing. It was actually less terrible than it sounds--I managed to keep the room comfortable by heating it up before I went to bed. By the next morning, the room would be chilly, but not unbearable. But really. Is a modern heating system too much to ask?

Reviews.Title: “it was OK”
Reviews.Author: n_hejazy
Reviews.Content: It was OK, but the neighbourhood was quite shabby. Though this is the nearest Days Inn to downtown Toronto. But could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but good location”
Reviews.Author: BostonSkier
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the Wilderness Canoe Conference that we attended , but the hotel is a bit dated. Clean rooms, the free continental breakfast was adequate. Room had a strong sanitizer smell. Rooms are very narrow.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: dotty023
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Days Inn twice, in 2007 and 2008, with my caregiver. We both found it clean, pleasant, friendly, and ideally located for our needs. It was fun to go back a second time and be greeted as though visiting old friends. Of course, it is not a luxury hotel, just a wonderful, friendly, homey place to stay, at a price which fits my budget. I am looking forward to another stay in just a few weeks' time. Doris Gregory.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: my2cents2
Reviews.Content: This is the dirtiest, most poorly kept hotel Iâ€™ve ever visited. The rooms have high ceilings with very small windows and no ventilation. Even the ventilation in the bathroom was completely in effective. I asked to be moved to another room but all the rooms had a very musty, moldy odor like and old, wet canvas bag. This odor permeated all the fabrics in the room. I asked to cancel my reservation but they insist on 24-hour notice, naturally since I imagine a high percentage of guests wish to cancel upon arrival. After spending one night at the hotel I noticed a huge red stain on the mattress and I could not take it anymore. I left for another hotel, which easily met my requirements, but was forced to pay for another night at the Days Inn Toronto Beaches, despite my requesting to cancel at 8:30 AM of that day and despite the obvious and objective problems with the hotel. You canâ€™t expect much from people who would run a hotel in this manner, anyone who writes a positive review for this hotel must simply not be accustomed to cleanliness and courteous service. Avoid this hotel and its staff at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Rtiz, but I've Never Gone Wrong Here.”
Reviews.Author: bobalbin
Reviews.Content: It's a Days Inn what can I say? It's clean safe, comfortable and well located just outside of downtown Toronto. I usually have business in Scarborough and this location beats any of the highway places closer to there. The beaches neighborhood has plenty of pubs, bistros and shops. Very good staff. The price makes it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent room and service for the price; safe, convenient, and fun thanks to Anthony!!!”
Reviews.Author: betacloud
Reviews.Content: The BEST part of this place is Anthony, he's the guy behind the desk, but more on him later... Yeah- it's a typical Days Inn: consistent, clean, secure. It's in the 'Beaches' district on Queen st. East. Nice neighborhood, free parking in a secured lot, and all kinds of local stores- wine/beer/liquor, coffe shops, deli's, and a few really good restaraunts less than a block away, a really cool location. Killer selection of local restaraunts, Thai, Indian, Japanese, Deli's, Italian, you name it. Toward the beach- about 5 blocks up, lots of cool shops that way too. Great Indian food at Ali's at 2306 Queen st. E- fantastic entrees and great service. My own and my lady friend's favorite Indian restaraunt on the planet so far. So back to Anthony: Considerate, gracious, goes all out for the customer. Great sense of humor, a real lovable character! I'll definitely stay there again, My gal and i had a great time. Anthony rocks!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay of our trip to USA/Canada”
Reviews.Author: anniemaywollongong
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ Days Inn Beaches for one week in September 2007. The staff were absolutely by far the most helpful and courteous we came across during our stay in Canada & New York. The room was clean and had everything we required. Commute into Toronto was easy by tram which was available right in front of hotel. There were lovely little restaurants within close walking distance(try the Indian restaurant next door, GREAT FOOD) and a great Irish pub about 2 doors down. Cinema's across the road and a quick stroll to the lake foreshore which was also very beautiful. It was safe, quiet and above all the treatment we received as visitors from another country was fabulous. The complimentary breakfast was also a bonus. There was only one downside and that was if your room was on level 1 there was no lift so you had to carry your bags up 1 flight of steps. The price was great and even though not in the heart of Toronto ,was such an easy 10min ride by tram it was not difficult to get there. Trams ran every 5-10 mins and also were very safe. I travelled into Toronto a couple of time alone and being female was not he least bit scared of doing this. Would recommend this hotel to anyone thinkig of going to Toronto. Anne & Steve from WOLLONGONG NSW AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. stay away!”
Reviews.Author: JUDGMENT
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE TERRIBLE service. the staff is clueless, and NOT helpful at all. seems they dont care. I had a very important issue and they didnt want to hear about it! ONLY THEY COULD HAVE HELPED ME! do not stay! go to other days inn NOT THIS ONE!! cant stress that enough. DIRTY PLACE

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaBC
Reviews.Content: Having read several terrible reviews, my grand-daughter and I chose to stay at Days Inn Toronto East Beaches due to being in a convenient location to visit family members. Our stay was December 15th to 18th. We were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel staff very friendly and helpful. The bathroom was spotless, the beds comfortable and the bagels and croissants at breakfast were fresh. They provided decent coffee and quality jams. My grand-daughter tells me that the fruit loops were good too! Based on what we had read we chose an upstairs room and had no mouldy smell. Our room was non-smoking but initially there was a smell of cigarettes, possibly wafting in from the hallway. On Saturday there was some noise from other guests celebrating that Maple Leafs had won their hockey game, other than that, our room was close to the back, facing a quiet side street allowing us to sleep well. We would stay there again. Being a Days Inn, the hotel was not fancy but we had a pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Filth & Sloth... Slums”
Reviews.Author: TheCommissioner
Reviews.Content: Dirty, filthy rooms. Mildew stench. pictures missing from the walls. No windows open on the ground floor. Greasy drips & markings on hotel room walls. filthy water, ran a bath and the water was brown-yellow and the maintenance could not fix this for 2.5 hours...could not even brush my teeth let alone keep dinner down after seeing that. Rude, rude staff. Even more rude manager/owner who pretends to be the maintenance manager (FYI) Old fruit loops served for breakfeast.. Coffee only on in the lobby during the early a.m. hours. No coffee in rooms. Alarm clocks do not work. phone calls cut off mid sentence. hotel message system not working correctly. grose place, owner is a slum lord in my humble opinion. Big mistake to stay there and will never do it again.... just grose.. Hotel beds tiney and short as if made for midgets and I am only 5 ft 6 and 115 lbs! dirty bed spreads, just do yourself a big favor and never stay here..

Reviews.Title: “Run away fast fast fast”
Reviews.Author: gibbrn
Reviews.Content: I am a registered nurse and would never ever recommend anybody stay at this hotel as it is a mold from hell hotel. The service was horrible aside from the cleaning staff, they were nice, but room was awful. Mold on shower curtain was so gross made them change it. could not use the air conditioner because of mold smell. Dirt in bathroom....toilet brown spots inside with hair, bathroom door had brown stains all down it, garbage can had mold growing in it. Rude rude rude staff at desk. Told other friends of ours to go find another hotel when they tried to book.....turns out good advice!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: helencook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my brother whilst we were on holiday visiting friends for a wedding. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly, particularly the maids. It was a very basic breakfast (juice/coffee/croissants/bagels/butter/jam) but the rooms were large and clean. Less than 5 minutes walk from the beach so a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: christinaJ333
Reviews.Content: Knowing this was a trendy area of Toronto, I thought I would give it a try based upon location and price. I wasn't disappointed. Certainly not a fancy hotel, but clean, cozy and excellent staff. A small place of about 50 rooms with free parking in the heart of the city. Super value. Close to almost anything you would want to go to in Toronto. I booked a smoking room, and even though I smoke, I hate the smell of stale smoke. I found the room a bit musty and the housekeeping staff cheerfully and immediately freshened it up. I asked for extra towels, pillows and again they were there right away. The next day, I woke with a headache and felt I needed more time to rest. I called the front desk to ask if I could check out an hour later and they said no problem and there was no surcharge. Conveniently there's a pub/restaurant right next door. Rooms are clean, excellent location, free parking,continental breakfast and great staff. Excellent value

Reviews.Title: “OK, but would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: OnBliss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for three nights and probably will pick another one if we were to go back. The worst part was the really stale and limited breakfast. Why even bother if you don't care what you serve? The corridors were dim and dull. There was no pool and heck, not even a laundry. The only good part was, we barely spent any time at the hotel during the day. For the price we paid ($85), we could have gotten a little deal. The location was, however, OK.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn - Toronto East Beaches
HotelInfo.Address: 1684 Queen Street East, Toronto, Ontario M4L 1G6, Canada
